newsitem.title: CAPE VERDE: Cape Verde to sell stake in Enacol fuel concern.
newsitem.headline: Cape Verde to sell stake in Enacol fuel concern.

text.p: Cape Verde will decide this week whether Portugal's Petrogal or French oil company Elf will take a stake in its fuel company, Empresa Nacional de Combustiveis de Cabo Verde (Enacol), a government spokesman said.
Cape Verde is selling off a 65 percent stake in Enacol, worth an estimated $20 to $30 million, to foreign investors.
It has already sold 32.5 percent of this stake to Angola's Sonangol and Petrogal and Elf are now bidding for the remainder.
"It would be better for the company if Elf wins because Elf is already set up on the west African coast and has better technological development than Petrogal," an Enacol spokesman told Reuters.
In the second phase of Enacol's privatisation, the government will sell off a further 25 percent to domestic investors, leaving the state with a golden share of 10 percent.
